title: Spirit Visage on Vladimir
body: Is spirit visage still good on Vladimir, because I never see it being built anymore. And if it isn't, why is it not good on him anymore?

replies.body: The HP-to-damage scaling on his E went down. So basically {{item:3065}} makes vlad do less damage than before. Also His AP ratios were buffed so building ap is more rewarding now and building HP is less rewarding.

Ok thank you very much for the response. I was looking at his patch history and noticed that his health to AP went from 25 to 40 and AP to health went from 1 to 1.4, so this would make spirit visage less viable, but would you still want to buy it into worse matchups so you can get the extra heal from the passive?
If you want your opponent AP-TOP cry... do it. But it's not that much of go to Item for him right now. ^^

However, the {{item:3152}} + full AP build has caught on fire in the pro scene. 

I'm practicing the new build too because I believe either next patch or the next {{item:3065}} on Vladimir will finally be over (without CDR, its going to suck).

For this patch I still build it (all other items are full AP)... it makes him a powerful 100-0 burst battle tank.

I usually do {{item:3158}} {{item:3157}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3285}} {{item:3089}} {{item:3135}}... sometimes I place a {{item:3067}} down and finish the SV later or last (if team needs more damage). 

Once you have 3 or 4 of the above items you can 1 vs 3/4 in some situations. 

Next patch though I think they are nerfing SV (no more CDR and less health), that might be the final blow to this build path and I may have to switch over to Protobelt + full AP. This changes his play style to more of an AOE burst mage than a battle mage (if you don't nuke out the key targets in at most 2 rotations, you are toast without SV).

I'd only rush it if I'm in a horrible matchup  like Leblanc or if I'm behind. Or if the enemy team has mostly AP. 

Otherwise I'll rush an abyssal.
